title: Your Friday Briefing: A Year of War
description: Also, Nigeria’s upcoming election and healthcare protests in China.

title: Prigozhin’s Feud With Russia’s Military Leaves Questions About Battlefield Results
description: The leader of Wagner appears to have backed down from his latest criticism of Russia’s senior command. But his vitriolic remarks suggested more discord in Russia’s war effort.

title: French Student to Be Charged With Premeditated Murder in Teacher’s Stabbing
description: Prosecutors painted a portrait of a troubled, socially awkward teenager who had been bullied, and who attempted suicide in October.

title: Ukraine Uses Strikes on Mariupol to Suggest It Now Has Longer-Range Weapons
description: Ukraine has used attack drones to hit relatively distant targets, but the new strikes paired with comments from a Ukrainian official stirred speculation that Kyiv may have acquired a new weapon.

title: Tom Whitlock, Writer of ‘Top Gun’ Anthem ‘Danger Zone,’ Dies at 68
description: Mr. Whitlock’s songs, including the chart-topping “Take My Breath Away,” were central to the 1986 movie.

title: Yellen Calls for More Ukraine Support and Warns China Against Helping Russia
description: Ahead of a meeting of G20 finance ministers, the Treasury secretary offered a dark assessment of Russia’s economy and warned China of the consequences of helping Moscow skirt U.S. sanctions.

title: Wind and Solar Energy Projects Are Overwhelming America’s Antiquated Electrical Grids
description: An explosion in proposed clean energy ventures has overwhelmed the system for connecting new power sources to homes and businesses.

title: John Motson, BBC’s Voice of Soccer for Five Decades, Dies at 77
description: The broadcaster announced English soccer’s biggest moments, including 10 World Cups.

title: John Motson, BBC’s Voice of Soccer for Five Decades, Dies at 77
description: The broadcaster announced English soccer’s biggest moments, including 10 World Cups.

title: Live Updates: Ukraine Anticipates Surge in Russian Attacks on Eve of War’s Anniversary
description: Additional security measures are being put in place in parts of the country, and schools have been advised to switch to remote learning.

title: A Guide to the 2024 Republican Presidential Campaign
description: We offer a field guide to the 2024 Republican presidential campaign.

title: Two Above the Rest
description: We offer a field guide to the 2024 Republican presidential campaign.

title: Bulgarian Factories and Secret Task Forces: How the West Hunts for Soviet Arms
description: Ukraine has long relied on Russian weapons for its armed forces. Now it is scrambling to get Soviet-era ammunition for those weapons, with the help of manufacturers even in rural corners of Eastern Europe.

title: Turkish Builders Come Under Intense Scrutiny Over Shoddy Construction
description: More than 43,000 deaths in Turkey from an earthquake have raised painful and angry questions over whether some of those fatalities could have been avoided with better building standards.

title: Tech Leaders in Israel Wonder if It’s Time to Leave
description: Ahead of a judicial overhaul that could transform the country and frighten away investors, the executives of Start-Up Nation are mulling an exodus.

title: Northern Ireland Brexit Deal Is Gamble for British Prime Minister
description: Ever since Britain voted to leave the European Union, the question of Northern Ireland’s border has bedeviled prime ministers. Rishi Sunak’s effort to broker a deal is already under threat.

title: More Than 50 Missing After Coal Mine Collapses in Northern China
description: By Thursday, four deaths had been confirmed as rescuers worked to save miners at the site in Inner Mongolia.

title: A National Treasure on the Rise, Then Hit With a Doping Allegation
description: A star Olympic runner from Australia was suspended over a positive drug test of a kind that critics have called alarmingly open to human error.

title: Global Declines in Maternal Mortality Have Stalled
description: Death rates in the United States have increased in recent years, as they have in Europe, the W.H.O. reported.

title: Putin and Biden Shore Up Alliances in Dueling Appearances
description: On the surface, it looked like a reversion to the Cold War era. The reality was even more complicated.

title: Mexico Hobbles Election Agency That Helped End One-Party Rule
description: The changes come ahead of a presidential election next year and are part of a pattern of challenges to democratic institutions across the Western Hemisphere.
